708372f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue at 22nd Street and north, showing at right the old Hotel St. Germain.

On the S.E. corner of 22nd Street a small house has just been demolished. The brick house below it, in right foreground, is new. The hotel, built in 1853-54, is also new. The remainder of this triangular block, today (1935) the site of the Flatiron Building, will by 1859 be filled with four small houses facing on Fifth Avenue.

The houses on the S.W. corner of 22nd Street are new. On the N.W. corner of 23rd Street stands the short-lived Franconi's New York Hippodrome, about to be torn down for the erection of the Fifth Avenue Hotel (at first called the Mount Vernon Hotel), 1859-1908.

In the background may be seen the spire of the Marble Collegiate Church (Dutch Reformed), at N.W. corner of 29th Street. Some of the houses which may be seen on E. 26th Street across Madison Square were standing as late as 1912.

Compare this early photograph with the same view in 1903 and 1925. 1855 or 1856.

MAY BE REPRODUCED.
Neg. #5042

708371f-a.text:
North on Fifth Avenue from 22nd Street.
White Building at left is famous Fifth Avenue Hotel, which opened in 1859 and was torn down in 1908. 1903.

Brown Brothers, Photographers.

NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708373f-a.text:
172-176 Fifth Avenue, at N.W. corner of 22nd Street. 1923.

MAY BE REPRODUCED.

711603f-a.text:
1-47 West 22nd Street, adjoining N.W. corner of Fifth Ave. The gap between buildings marks a vacant lot, 37-45 West 22nd Street. No. 5 West 22nd Street, site of home of Samuel F.B. Morse—Tablet on present building reads: "In this house Samuel F.B. Morse lived for many years and died. This tablet removed from building formerly on this site and replaced A.D. 1900." A picture of the original house and tablet is in: Wilson, R.R. New York old and new, 1902, Vol. 1, facing page 366.

June 1925.

MAY BE REPRODUCED.

708375f-a.text:
172 to 182 Fifth Avenue, west side, 22nd Street, north to middle of block.

June, 1928.

Neg. 2424

708374f-a.text:
N.W. corner Fifth Avenue and 22nd Street.
March 12, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708376f-a.text: Fifth Avenue, north across 22nd Street, showing just beyond the arterial crossroad formed by the intersection of the diagonal Broadway at Madison Square. The southerly apex is triangular site of the Fuller (Flatiron) Building that is shown at the right. The Park separates this from vague outline of the Brunswick Building at 26th Street. To the left is the blockfront extending from 22nd to 23rd Streets, dominated by the staid Fifth Avenue Building. About 1933

711604f-a.text: West 22nd Street, north side, between Fifth and Sixth Aves. Shown through clearance is Nos. 49-57 West 23rd Street, north side, east of Sixth Ave. May 22, 1935. P.L. Sperr.

711605f-a.text:
West 22nd Street, south side, west from, but not including Fifth, to and including Sixth Aves.

May 22, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
